headline: Seasoned Turkey Burgers
description: This recipe has the best seasoning for turkey burgers, with onion soup mix, pepper, and soy sauce. Easy to make and great for dinner and barbecues.
name: Seasoned Turkey Burgers
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix

recipeInstructions.text: Mix turkey with egg, onion soup mix, soy sauce, pepper, and garlic powder in a large bowl. Refrigerate the mixture for about 10 minutes, then form into 6 patties.
Preheat the grill for medium-high heat.

Lightly oil the grill grate. Place patties on the grill. Cook, turning once, until well done, about 20 minutes. The inside of the burgers will look whitish in color when cooked through. Serve on buns.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! Moist & very flavorful. I added 1 tsp. ground ginger and worcestershire sauce (in equal amount to the soy sauce) . Everyone loved it. Served it with corn on the cob & roasted brussel sprouts.
Awesome recipe. Very tasty and easy.

Fabulous! I have made these for years and even my teenage boys love them! Easy and flavorful! I generally just cook in frying pan. Easier to keep together. Note: cook immediately out of frig, they stay together better.
OMG.. I have never liked turkey burgers, but this recipe has me LOVING them now. So delicious! Thank you for saving my trying-to-be-healthy tastebuds and giving me back my juicy hamburgers!
This is my go to recipe for burgers! Absolutely delightful.
Prepared recipe as written. I took a suggestion from another comment, and preheated the grill before putting the turkey burgers on. Really very good, a welcome change from boring old turkey burgers.

I just made this recipe and it is fantastic! I used a package of beefy onion soup mix and I did add 3 tablespoons of plain Panko bread crumbs. it turns out I'm not sure if I even really needed them because killing them in the fridge for 10 minutes made an incredible difference. They held together beautifully on my grill pan and are wonderful. This will be a new staple in my house, thanks for the recipe.
Another thing I add to my turkey burgers and turkey meatloaf is stove top stuffing! Absolutely delicious!!! Happy cooking my friends! So glad I found this site :)
I made this with ground beef instead of turkey. The placed the patties in the freezer for a few minutes prior to grilling and they turned out perfect - very flavorful and moist.
Because I don't like a lot of heat, I didn't put the green chilies in. It was delicious.

Wonderful! I was afraid the burgers would fall apart, but if you let them sear on one side first they hold together quite well.
With a slice of onion and cheese to finish off the flip side, you would never know it wasn't beef.

These are good. My husband is not a fan of turkey burgers, but he said he would like these again. Not sure if the garlic powder is necessary given the onion soup mix is also in it. I also added Panko breadcrumbs, as I think it helps hold turkey burgers together better.

Turned out great. I had to improvise. I used some left over ranch powder, real garlic, some chicken seasoning, and onion powder. Also added the soy sauce as recommended and they were delish. Kids loved it. Also didn’t have burger buns so used the Pillsberry croissant and made into circular flat patty then popped in oven. Love love love.

Turned out great. I had to improvise. I used some left over ranch powder, real garlic, some chicken seasoning, and onion powder. Also added the soy sauce as recommended and they were delish. Kids loved it. Also didn’t have burger buns so used the Pillsberry croissant and made into circular flat patty then popped in oven. Love love love.
super easy and yummy. my kids love it.

These were great! My husband wanted to prepare these, instead of purchasing frozen turkey burgers. I was really proud of him, as he is usually only known for his grilling. These were fixed exactly as directed, and everyone at our family dinner (3 generations) loved them!

These were fantastic.. followed the recipe exactly except I added panko breadcrumbs..I understand the onion soup mix is really high in sodium so I might try a way to lower the sodium but boy, these were tasty!
WONDERFUL not salty at all

I have made this recipe numerous times. The only change I made was to use grated fresh garlic, 2 cloves instead of garlic powder. This is a spectacular recipe, burgers turn out very flavorful and very juicy. I saute them for about 5 minutes a side. add a salad or hot vegigie and you have a terrific dinner or lunch. I eat them without the roll, just plain on the plate with a little Heinz spicy ketchup. YUM, YUM,YUM
I used 2 pounds of ground turkey instead of 1 1/2 pounds and the seasoning was perfect . The whole family enjoyed the burgers. Great alternative since we are trying to eliminate beef from our diet.

Awesome turkey burgers! Great flavor and not at all dry, like turkey burgers can sometimes be. I omitted the pepper, only because I'm not a big fan of it. I used 1 lb. of ground turkey instead of 1 1/2 lb. so I cut the onion soup mix quantity in half. Also, onion soup mix tends to be salty so didn't want to over-do it. I added a slice of colby-jack cheese the last minute or so and covered the pan to melt. Love this recipe and will be making frequently!
I just made these tonight. We only had 1 lb of ground turkey so we added a few Italian seasoned breadcrumbs and a smidge of Worcestershire sauce. These were an absolute hit in my book!!

Since the turkey is only sold in 16 oz (1 lb) package, I had to cut down on other ingredients (w/o egg). This formed 6 mini-size (sliders) burgers that everyone enjoyed. I used Worchester instead of soy sauce.
Made it according to the recipe and it was really good. No changes needed. Yum!

We loved them! My 8 y/o wanted cheeseburgers for dinner. 1/2 way through eating I asked what he thought. He loves them. (picky eater) That's when I told him I guess he likes turkey burgers now :-) This recipe is a keeper! Super easy to make and delicious.

I loved this, and so did my family. Because the mixture seemed soft, I added some Panko crumbs to hold it together a little better. Easy to make, with lots of flavor, I will be making this recipe again.
The extended family loved the burgers. Only adjustments I made was to cut the soy sauce in half and used minced garlic instead of garlic powder. Next time I'll try organic soup mix instead.

I have 5 people to feed in my family. If I had not told them it was turkey, they would have never known the difference between this and 80/20 ground beef. They were totally shocked! It tastes amazing!

Yum! This was tasty. I did make a couple of minor changes - I made this into a meatloaf and we ended up having meatloaf sandwiches with cheese and mayonnaise, and because it was a meatloaf I added some breadcrumbs to help combine it better. I also used low sodium soy sauce (which I do with most recipes). The turkey flavour really shone through, which I loved. Will be making again.

My girlfriend loved them, I hated them. 

They were easy to prep and cook. No problems with sticking or crumbling on the grill. 

I used fresh mince garlic and...I may have gone overboard. 

The biggest problem was getting blasted in the face with onion soup. Not my thing.
Really great. Used Worcestershire sauce since I had no soy sauce. Awesome! All the flavor I was looking for.
Very very good. Just be careful with the seasonings. Less is more. Will make again
Simple and tasty....I will be making these again!
This was amazing!I was really surprised that my 12 year old son ate itt because he hates burgers

This has been a favorite of our family and friends for a long time. We even had a guest once that couldn't believe they were turkey burgers. He said if he had known it was a turkey burger before we gave it to him, he woulnd't have eaten it. He loved it.
I used low sodium soy sauce and it didn't come out too salty. Super easy, super good.

Definitely will make these again. I followed the recipe except I did not use onion soup mix because I forgot to buy it. Instead a used seasoned bread crumbs. I put the burgers on the grill & it was a hit with my family.
Made as-is and cooked on the George Foreman grill on a snowy Sunday afternoon. The family loved.... No changes needed!
Love this recipe, it's a staple at our house. I add ~ a tablespoon of Sriracha to give them a little kick. So good!
The only downside was on my part, I cooked the burgers a little too long. However, I did a couple of drops of lemon juice & that created a nice balance.
I used this recipe for my first time making turkey burgers. So far so good. On the grill now. I did use garlic pepper instead of plain garlic and added a dash of hot sauce. Smells great grilling
This recipe is great I can not eat hamburger so this is a good recipe for me and my family. My husband said tasted like a hamburger to him
My picky hubby and kids loved this recipe!I liked it as well.
This is a hit at my house. The recipe is perfect just as it is. The only other thing I do is add a little bit of Italian breadcrumbs into the mix to help form the patties.
This recipe was super easy, and tasted fantastic! I cooked them on the stove on low heat, and they came out perfect.

These turkey burgers were amazing - flavorful, juicy, delicious! I can't wait until winter is over so I can grill them. I can only imagine how tasty they will be then. :) I forgot the egg, and they were still great.

my family loved this! i substituted liquid smoke for the soy sauce because i have one child who doesn't like soy sauce. the burgers are really sticky, so don't forget to oil the grill, but they hold together nicely once they are cooked.
These were delicious! Very easy to make. I love the taste of the burger. We eat turkey burgers a lot, and this is my new favorite recipe! Thanks for sharing!
I cut back on the soy and it was amazing! Keeper!
So simple to make with delicious flavors. Even my husband enjoyed these!
This recipe was great!!!!! These burgers were bangin!!!
This recipe is delicious and perfect just the way it is! My whole picky family loved it, even the tried and true gut buster ground beef burger fans.
This was really nice. Very flavorful. Will add to my burger recipe folder. Thank you!
Even better without the bun
I followed this recipe exactly. It was perfect just like it is. It was NOT too salty at all. The best turkey patty I've ever eaten.

A good turkey burger, but kind of bland except for being on the salty side. Used bbq sauce instead of soy to try and cut the saltiness. Our package of turkey was only 1.2lbs, so added about a half cup of bread crumbs to stretch it a little and got 4 nice-sized patties. Pan fried well, don't know that I would put these on the grill.
Everyone really liked these a lot. It was a bit mushy, so I had to put in some plain bread crumbs. Next time, I'll just use a little less of the soup mix also. Will definitely make again.

Recently I moved into an apartment and had to donate my grill so I wasn't sure how these burgers would do in a skillet. To my surprise, they turned out fabulous and quite juicy...to keep them from burning on the outside before they cooked through I added some water to the pan after the juices had time to accumulate and then covered to keep the steam. I always worry with ground turkey that I will undercook it, so I did try and check by cutting into the burger and then cooking them five minutes past when I thought they may be done. Luck was on my side as they were cooked, yet still juicy!
These were the first turkey burgers I have ever made and I fell in love! They were not salty at all. I had mine with smoked gouda cheese and chipotle mayo. Delish!
I enjoyed these turkey burgers and the family agreed with lots of yums! I left out the soy sauce, but kept everything else the same.

YUM! I had a 2.5 pound pack of ground turkey from Sam's club, and found this recipe. I added 1 tsp of garlic powder, used lower sodium soy sauce, and added 1 Tbsp of worcestershire sauce. I kept the amounts of everything else the same. I used a old peanut butter lid lined with plastic wrap to press the burgers, and I came out with 10. I grilled them, along with some other burgers for my husband. He really liked these burgers, and said whatever I did 'different' he really liked!
I've had other turkey burgers and have never been a fan. Decided to give this one a shot...Holy Cow...well, Holy Turkey...AWESOME. Added some lettuce and tomato on a deli thin bun...Perfect!
Delicious and easy! I used 99% fat free turkey, reduced sodium soy sauce (although they were still slightly salty) and one egg white to make it healthier. Will definitely make these again!
Loved these - super moist and really flavorful. Followed recipe to a t. They were a bit hit at 4th of July BBQ.
These burgers were yummy! I will definitely use this recipe again
My entire family loved these! Im more of a beef fan but with a lil mayo and tomato it was so yummy.
Fantastic recipe! I substituted low sodium soy sauce and we just loved them. They were moist and flavorful.
Can't miss when grilled some can't tell it's not beef.

These are phenomenal! My husband requests these all the time. We don't have an outside grill, so we use his panini grill, and it works great! (And cuts down the cook time to about five minutes.) Will make again and again!

Prepared these exactly as directions state. I thought they were pretty good. Not overly salty, in my opinion. The taste kind of reminded me of a Salisbury steak. I made them on our Foreman Grill, cooked for about 15 minutes. Got 5 good- size patties. I served them on a sesame bun with tomato slices, swiss cheese and avocado. I would probably rate them 3.5 stars if I could but my husband thought they were great. He said they were the best turkey burgers I've made, so I feel like 4 stars is fair. Thanks for recipe!
burger come out juicy
Best turkey burger I've come across anywhere. We season ours with mesquite barbecue seasoning while grilling.
This is the best turkey burger I've ever eaten - very flavorful and my kids loved it! Patties are very moist and juicy and work great on the grill.

These were delicious!! I did however make a few changes. I used Worchestershire sauce instead of soy sauce, minced cloves of garlic instead of garlic powder, and added 2 Tbl of plain breadcrumbs. I cooked them on the Foreman for about 10-15 minutes and topped each burger with a slice of Reduced Fat Pepper Jack cheese! My boyfriend (who refuses to eat turkey burgers) loved them as well!!

These are amazing! My husband is not a big turkey burger fan and he said these are his favorite burgers. I didn't have onion soup mix so I used dried minced onions. Usually when I do that I add salt and pepper but I skipped the salt since it calls for soy. I also used low sodium soy.
Perfect as is! I make these all the time and they are full of flavor and a joy to eat!
We now like turkey burgers better than beef burgers using this recipe.

My husband will not eat anything I make with ground turkey because he says "it has a specific taste". When I made this recipe, he not only ate it, but he said "this meat was really good". I made it in a pan instead of the grill because we live in a condo and do not have a bbq. I used 15% fat turkey and even saved some of the mixture to make the following day. I think that one was even better that the first days batch. The second day, we had them with white basmati rice instead of hamburger style (more like a kabob style). YUMMY!
always add the egg! toasted wheat bun and avocado. simple and healthy!

I love these burgers! They are easy to put together, juicy and flavorful. I used 1 pound of foster farms ground turkey. To that I added 1 package of Lipton Onion Soup Mix and 1 garlic clove, egg, slightly beaten, little soy sauce and fresh ground black pepper. My patties may have been a little larger so I ended up with 5 instead of 6 burgers. They did not take long to cook up on the grill, about 20 minutes, only flipping once. I served these on hamburger buns with thick slices of local tomatoes and manoa lettuce. The burgers are well seasoned, nothing overpowering at all. They are juicy and tasty, not dry and not needing any extra condiments (ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise, etc) to the burgers. The preparation, ingredients and cooking time are approximate. I served the burgers along with, "Baked Sweet Potato Sticks," also from this website. These baked sweet potatoes are also VERY good by the way and complement the turkey burgers nicely.
I love these burger's!They are not salty at all . Thanks for sharing .
This was good for turkey burgers.
Bland
pretty good, but turned out really small. make larger next time?

These are so full of flavor! I added a little panko and a little parmesan cheese. My teens liked them so much that I made extra and put them in individual ziplock bags and froze them for after school snacks.
Wow! These are great! I made exactly as directed. I skipped the optional egg and only had a 1.25lb package of extra lean turkey. The burgers turned out great!!!! All I know is I'm hooked!

These burgers are so good! I had a 3 lb. pack of ground turkey, so I doubled the recipe, other than that I followed the recipe exactly. These are way better than any of the premade patties I've bought in the past.
These were a huge hit!!! I served them with a slice of pepper jack cheese and all the fixings! VERY flavorful and moist!
I made these on the grill. Very good, but a little salty.
We were so tired of the same old grilled turkey burgers. These burgers were the answer. My family loved them. We added avocado and bacon to the burgers as well as mayo, lettuce and tomato. Yum!
Tasted like pure onion soup mix; will not make again.

I made sliders using these ingredients... they were VERY tasty. even the picky eater who doesnt like hamburgers enjoyed them! The only change I sort of made was using low sodium soy sauce so they werent too salty.
I increased the recipe to 2 pounds of ground turkey, because I buy 1lb packages. We love them.

My husband loved these! The first time I made turkey burgers they were plain but this recipe has alot of flavor!Made 4 bugers out of this recipes and my husband toke the other 2 to work 2 days in a row and wants more.I served it on the wheat sandwich thins.A plus that its really healthy I used 93% lean turkey meat.I suggust you give it a try.
We've tried many other seasonings for turkey burgers and these were the best of all. No mods to recipe and they were perfect right off the grill.

Too salty, couldn't finish eating them. I would not add the soy sauce, even though it did not call for too much, that's all i could taste. The rest of the flavor was good but like i said way too salty. For us at least.

although I did enjoy these the first time I made them I found that there are better Turkey Burger recipes out there. 

They are just ok. 

I had to use only 1 Tablespoon of the onion soup mix, as I only make 1 pound of Turkey for my family of 4. 

I also seemed to always get a stomach ache every night after I would make these, I advise anyone to make these on the stove if you have stomach problems as it is very easy to over cook the outside and under cook the inside.

be sure to use the "lid" technique on ANY burgers...where you form the patties in a large plastic lid and then refrigerate to get even patties that hold together well, before I knew this all my burgers were uneven and lumpy

This sounded like it would be great. However, the patties we like mush (even after the chilling) and fell through the grill. This recipe needed breadcrumbs or something. TOTAL DISAPPOINTING FRUSTRATION!

Best Ever Turkey Burger.
I used beefy onion soup mix and add extra dehydrated onions. I also choose to leave of out the egg.
